9.15.17  5:46 pm   Sorry if I'm oversimplifying this (I know you do all types of content... scrambles, the question page, reality, jazz, improv, notebook, etc)... But it seems like you kind of "made a name for yourself" doing all the vines and short videos. Then you didn't want to get pigeon-holed as "The Guy Who Makes Short Videos" and when your fans came to expect more and more short videos, you put out HOJ and HOTEWIG. Then when everybody started demanding more and more history videos, you didn't want to get labeled as "The Guy Who Makes History Videos". Now, it seems like your focus is music videos for medium-length songs? My question is, what happens when everyone starts demanding more music videos and you become associated with this particular form of content? Will we see another big shift? Again, sorry if I'm oversimplifying your 'creative trajectory'. Like I said, I know you do all types of stuff. I'm a big fan of everything you put out, and you've been a huge inspirat ion to me as a musician myself, and as just a fellow person tryna be a person.  Thank you for everything you do.

9.15.17  5:41 pm   today i wrote a scenario which is one hour long in EIGHT FUCKING HOURS with EVERY DAMN DETAIL to put on the stage, like everything including songs, dances, decor, costumes, etc etc. this was probably the fastest (and deepest) writing of mine and it's long, it's good, it's strong and i want to cry with happiness. it seems your small steps advice is working and this is only the beginning. i don't feel like i'm drowning in infinity anymore, it's raining and i'm catching the drops. thank you bill. so, what's the next advice of yours for me?
